item.title: FRAGMENTING PHILIPPIANS
item.description:
FRAGMENTING PHILIPPIANS

I. Mood shift between 3:1 and 3:2

A. Basic questions: if a segment does not fit its context, why would an interpolator put it there; if it does fit its context, why regard it as an interpolation?

B. The interpolation in this case (as well as the cases of 2 Corinthians 6:14-7:1 and 2 Corinthians 10-13) does not form a unit. It is difficult to tell where such a document would end (3:19?; 4:1?; 4:3?).

item.title: PHILIPPIANS: THE TIME OF WRITING
item.description:
PHILIPPIANS: THE TIME OF WRITING

WITHIN THE ROMAN IMPRISONMENT

1:12-14: Enough time for Paul to influence the praetorian guard and others because of

their exposure to him while he was in prison

1:22-26; 2:24: Near the end of the imprisonment because Paul anticipates release from the

present circumstance
